#summary Distro-specific installation instructions for NautilusSvn v0.12
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy

= Dependencies =

== Ubuntu 8.10 ==

1. Install the following packages through your package manager.
{{{
sudo apt-get install python-nautilus python-configobj python-pyinotify python-gtk2 python-glade python-dbus python-svn subversion
}}}

== OpenSUSE 11.1 ==

1. In Yast -> Software Repositories.  Add the GNOME:STABLE and GNOME:Community repositories.

2. Install packages:
{{{
zypper install python-nautilus dbus-1-python dbus-1-python-devel python-gtk python-gtk-devel python-pysvn gcc
}}}

3. Get python-pyinotify http://pyinotify.sourceforge.net/
    * Must get v0.7.1, as 0.8.x doesn't work atm
    * Uncompress the bz2 file and in the pyinotify folder type: sudo python setup.py install

4. Get python-configobj at http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/configobj.html#files
    * Copy configobj.py to /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/

5. Edit the file /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/pysvn/__init__.py
    There is a place where it says:
{{{
elif maj_min == (2,5):
    ....  
}}}      
    Add another elif block, like this...
{{{     
elif maj_min == (2,6):
    import _pysvn_2_6
    _pysvn = _pysvn_2_6
}}}

== Fedora 10 ==

1. Install Packages:
{{{
yum install nautilus-python dbus-python pysvn python-configobj gnome-python2-devel subversion
}}}

2. Get python-pyinotify http://pyinotify.sourceforge.net/
  a. Must get v0.7.1, as 0.8.x doesn't work atm
  b. Can get a Fedora 9 RPM from here: http://rpmfind.net/linux/rpm2html/search.php?query=python-inotify

  Note: I couldn't get the bz2 file from the pyinotify site to install, but the Fedora 9 0.7.1 RPMs linked to above will install and work for F10.
